org.xflatdb.xflat

Interface Database

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    XFlatDatabase

    public interface Database
    An interface for a Database managing one or more Tables.
    The Database allows getting and using Tables, and also provides access to the TransactionManager which can open Transactions.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> Table<T> getTable(java.lang.Class<T> persistentClass)
      Gets a table that converts the data to the persistent class.
      <T> Table<T> getTable(java.lang.Class<T> persistentClass, java.lang.String name)
      Gets the named table that converts the data to the given persistentClass.
      TransactionManager getTransactionManager()
      Gets the database's TransactionManager.

    • Method Detail

      • getTable

        <T> Table<T> getTable(java.lang.Class<T> persistentClass)
        Gets a table that converts the data to the persistent class.

        The table will be named with the class' simple name.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The generic class of the persistentType
        Parameters:
        persistentClass - The persistent class, which the Database can convert to and from Element.
        Returns:
        A table for manipulating rows of the persistent class.

      • getTable

        <T> Table<T> getTable(java.lang.Class<T> persistentClass,
                    java.lang.String name)
        Gets the named table that converts the data to the given persistentClass.

        Multiple different classes of data can be stored in the same named Table provided certain conditions are met.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The generic class of the persistentType
        Parameters:
        persistentClass - The persistent class, which the Database can convert to and from Element.
        name - The name of the table.
        Returns:
        A table for manipulating rows of the persistent class.

      • getTransactionManager

        TransactionManager getTransactionManager()
        Gets the database's TransactionManager. The TransactionManager allows opening transactions in the database.
        Returns:
        The database's TransactionManager.
